summary: systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE) is the prototypic autoimmune complex disease. it is characterized by excessive production of autoantibodies against a broad range of self-antigens. lupus nephritis remains a cause of substantial morbidity and mortality. the single-nucleotide polymorphism (SNP) TNF- 308 G > A (rs1800629) is located on chromosome 6p21.3, within the class III region of MHC. the TNF- 308 A allele has been reported to be a stronger transcriptional activator in vitro than the common G allele. the aim of this study is to investigate the association between TNF- 308 G > A and IFN- + 874 A > T gene polymorphisms with the SLE susceptibility and severity among Egyptian subjects. subjects were recruited from the Urology and Nephrology Center, Mansoura University, Egypt. PCR amplification was carried out using veriti® thermal cycler (Applied Biosystems, USA) in a 20 l total volume containing about 100 ng of genomic DNA template. primer sequences for INF- were as follows: reverse primer: 5′-TCA ACA AAG CTG ATA CTC CA-3′, INF- A forward primer: 5′-TTC TTA CAA AAA ATC AAA TCA-3′, INF- A. PCR conditions consisted of an initial denaturation step at 95 °C for 2 min, 10 cycles of incubation at 95 °C for 15 s, 62 °C for 50 s and 72 °C for 40 s. the amplified PCR products were analyzed by agarose gel and ethidium bromide staining followed by ultraviolet visualization.
